file_summary: This Java test class, `I18nPropertiesSyncTest`, is responsible for ensuring the proper implementation of internationalization (I18n) within the Spring PetClinic application. It contains two main test methods. The first, `checkNonInternationalizedStrings()`, scans all `.java` and `.html` files in the `src/main` directory (excluding test files) to detect any hard-coded text literals in HTML that are not marked for internationalization (i.e., not using Thymeleaf's `th:text` or Spring Expression Language `#{}`). The second test, `checkI18nPropertyFilesAreInSync()`, verifies that all internationalization property files (e.g., `messages_fr.properties`, `messages_de.properties`) contain all the keys present in the base `messages.properties` file, ensuring no partial translations across different locales. If any non-internationalized strings or missing translation keys are found, the tests will fail, promoting consistent and complete I18n support.
